meanings.sent1: The wabbly table almost tipped over.
meanings.sent2: She felt wabbly on her feet after spinning around.
meanings.sent3: The wabbly kitten tried to balance on the narrow ledge.
meanings.sent4: His wabbly confidence made him doubt his decisions.
meanings.sent5: The wabbly bridge swayed in the wind, making everyone nervous.

meanings.definition: To move unsteadily from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The old man wabbly walked across the room.
meanings.sent2: The boat wabbly rocked in the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The dancer wabbly shuffled across the stage, trying to keep up with the music.
meanings.sent4: The leaves wabbly fluttered to the ground in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The drunkard wabbly stumbled out of the bar, barely able to stand.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of stability or firmness.
meanings.sent1: The wabbly chair creaked under his weight.
meanings.sent2: Her wabbly voice betrayed her nervousness during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The wabbly excuse he gave for being late was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: The wabbly relationship finally crumbled under the pressure.
meanings.sent5: The wabbly foundation of the house caused cracks to appear in the walls.
